Notes: - Improved audio

- Fix for iOS 3 crash
- Improved sound quality
- Improved Bluetooth support

This is a bug fix version. Stay tuned for new features soon...

- Fixed: Viber is stuck on busy after network-related problems
- Fixed: on iOS 3.1.x, after exiting Viber, starting Viber again immediately may fail
- Fixed: on iOS 3.1.x, registration restarts when exiting Viber to read SMS
- Fixed: voice engine audio interrupt issues (e.g. incoming GSM call)
- Fixed: Ringback tone sometimes not heard via speakers
- Fixed: crash during startup
- Fixed: call screen disappears during call
- Workaround: no-audio problem after using an old (1.1) Bluetooth device
- Added: help on how to turn notifications back on
- Added: help with activation (SMS) issues
- Cosmetic changes

We’ve got new features!

* Call quality indicator: keep track of your call quality with the new call quality indicator! During a Viber call, you’ll find the indicator at the top right-hand corner of your call screen. This will show you the quality of your network, which affects your Viber conversation quality.

* Privacy policy: We respect your privacy. View the policy right off of the Viber application – simply go to the ‘More’ tab and click on Privacy Policy.

Bugs be-gone!

* Voice quality improvement: our top priority is to deliver the best audio calls. We made changes and improvements to make it even better…!

* Call connection improvement: did some of your Viber calls get stuck on ‘Answering…’? Or did you not hear your friend well at the start of your conversation? 
We made fixes based on your feedback and requests. Let us know if you still experience any of these issues.

* Bluetooth improvement: Bluetooth support is now working much better on Viber. So talk with a free Viber call, and hands free as well.

* Country code improvement: we have improved the country codes on Viber. If you have been having problems setting up Viber because of this issue, check the list of updates on our support site: http://support.viber.com/

And more bug fixes.

What’s New?
 
1.            Viber now has free text messaging!
Send and receive free text messages to and from all your Viber contacts. We’ve added a new tab called Messages. To send a text, simply select a contact from your list, and start texting for free.
New “Free Text Message” button added to Viber contact details. 
Tap this button to send this user a free message.
 
Viber will also notify you about incoming messages so you won’t miss a word single text.
 
2.            Favorites tab location changed 
To view your ‘Favorites’ - go to the contacts tab, and tap the Favorites button at the top.
 
3.            Improved calling mechanism 
Now, you’ll always know the status of your outgoing calls.
Once a call is placed, a “Calling” state will indicate that Viber is now connecting to the other party.
Once a connection is established, a “Ringing” state will indicate that the other party’s Viber, is now actually ringing (note that a call can still be established even if you don't see the "Ringing" state).
 
4.            Placing regular calls through Viber
A “Don’t show again” option was added for to the “Place a regular carrier call” inform dialog.
 
5.            Giving You More Control 
A new option provides the ability to deactivate your Viber account, so that you can easily reactivate Viber with a new phone number.
Find this option under the ‘More’ menu.
 
Important! Don’t kill Viber!
 
To make sure you always get incoming call/message notifications and that an incoming Viber call is rejected as "busy" when you're on a regular call, we strongly recommend that you to keep Viber running in the background. 
This does not drain your battery or use up memory and improves your Viber experience.
 
Bugs be-gone! 
 
1. Who has Viber?
Missed out on some Viber contacts? We’ve now improved the Viber recognition engine. So check out your Viber contact list, and see who else have has Viber.
 
2. Improved Badges
Viber badges are now more reliable and will notify you about the number of your missed calls & unread messages.
 
3. Connectivity
Since the release of Viber, we’ve continued making several improvements to our calling mechanism. On In Viber 2.0, we fixed the “stuck on answering” bug, and improved the time it takes calls to connect.
 
4. And other small fixes…

- Fixed graphics for standard resolution (e.g. 3GS)
- Disabled vibration for message reception/sending
- Bug fixes
bug fixes
Minor bug fixes

IMPORTANT: if you are still using iOS 3.x please do NOT upgrade to this version.

Viber for iPhone let’s lets you make free phone calls and send free text messages to other iPhone users that have Viber installed.

What’s New in Version 2.1
- iOS 5 compatible.
- Improved voice quality – All new Voice engine! Your calls will sound better than ever when talking to other users with Viber 2.1. Even on networks with less bandwidth, such as EDGE networks.
- Viber is now location-aware! Share your current location with your contacts so that they will know from where your message was sent. When sharing your current location, it will be attached to every outgoing message. You can enable or disable this option by tapping the location services icon inside the input box. 
- Viber now lets you send and receive Photos via Viber messages. To send photos, just tap on the ‘photos’ button, which has been added to the left of the input box.
You will now be able to take a photo, or send an existing one from your library.
- Share your photos with others - Photos can be shared on Facebook, sent via mail, and forwarded through Viber to other Viber contacts. 

User Experience
We are constantly working to improve the user experience on Viber; this involves research and analytics efforts along with reviewing your feedback.

- We changed the order of the tabs in order to improve accessibility to the ‘Messages’ section. This section contains all of your recent messages. You can now place calls right from the conversation screen.
- Know when your friend is there, and actually answering your recently sent message. New “is typing” indicator will be shown to notify you when he or she is typing a new message for you.
- Landscape support for Messages – the option you all were looking for is now supported.
- New and improved ‘Busy’ screen – if your contact is currently busy, you can simply leave him or her a free text message.
- Minor improvements to messages sending behavior - Viber will now try harder to deliver your messages: If your message was not sent, you will be notified, and you will have the option to resend it.
- We have rearranged the ‘More’ screen, and added new customization features that can be accessed via the new ‘Settings’ section.
- And of course we removed many many bugs…(and possibly added a few ☺ ).

***
If you have any suggestions, questions or comments, please visit: http://helpme.viber.com/
We are always happy to hear your thoughts.

With Viber, everyone in the world can connect. Freely. Viber has more than 754 million users worldwide sending messages and making HD-quality phone and video calls securely over Wi-Fi or mobile network - for free.* You can create group messages with up to 200 friends, share photos, video, GIFs, stickers, links and more. There’s no need to register – your phone number is your ID and Viber syncs with your mobile contact list automatically. If you want to make calls to non-Viber mobile and landline numbers, Viber Out credits offer low rates. You can also download Viber Wink to send messages that disappear after they’ve been viewed.

New Value:
Connect freely with over 800M users worldwide!

Viber is a free messaging and calling app that keeps you connected to anyone in the world through your Internet connection*. It’s the most expressive way to keep in touch with your loved ones and connect with anyone worldwide!  

Choose a contact from your phone book or simply enter a phone number to add a new contact on Viber. Make audio or video calls, text, share photos and videos, express yourself with thousands of stickers to choose from, record audio messages and even send files.

●	Group chat - Create groups with up to 200 participants and “like” messages when you don’t have time to reply
●	Hassle-free, long-distance calls - Free international calling without having to set up a username or provide login information
●	Voice or video - When voice isn’t enough, turn the video on! Enjoy the same HD-quality sound while having a face-to-face
●	Secured communications and trusted contacts - All messages and calls are protected by end-to-end encryption. Manually authenticate contacts to be sure you’re talking to the right person
●	Express yourself with stickers - Choose from a selection of thousands of stickers to say exactly what you mean
●	“Damage control” - Delete messages you regret sending
●	Hidden chats - Hide the chats you don’t want to be visible in your chat list and access them later with a PIN
●	Public Chats - Follow your favorite brands and personalities and get a glimpse into their behind-the-scenes lives
●	And much, much more - games, share contacts and location, see message information including who has seen and liked your messages

Install and start connecting now!

Follow Viber to see what's up:
Viber - www.viber.com/viber 
Facebook - http://facebook.com/viber 
Twitter - http://twitter.com/viber

(*) Viber uses your Internet connection. Wi-Fi is suggested for the best experience. Data charges may apply where you are connected through your network data plan.

●Secret messages  Set time limits on messages so they selfdestruct after they’ve been opened.  ●Send media as files  Keep photos and videos in their original size and quality when you choose to send them as files. ●Rich notifications on iOS 10  See the contents of your chats when you expand notifications on iOS 10.  ●Instant video messages  Tap and hold the instant video icon to capture the moment with 30second videos, release to send.
